channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: 'Mass masking' should be part of level 2, epidemiologist says
item.description: New Zealanders should wear masks in public indoor places under alert level 2 to stop the spread of the virus in the early stages of infection, epidemiologist Michael Baker says.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 7 May
item.description: As New Zealand waits to hear what level 2 restrictions will entail, Germany announced steps to ease the lockdown with an 'emergency brake' and the EU is forecast to go into a deep recession.

item.title: Covid-19: What will alert level 2 look like? NZ will find out more today
item.description: Today New Zealanders will find out what life will look like if Cabinet agrees to loosen lockdown restrictions next week.

item.title: MBIE branch turnover high, but industry happy with performance
item.description: Rapid turnover of staff has been hampering a government agency that's crucial to the pandemic recovery.

item.title: Efforts needed to help children avoid mental health consequences of lockdown
item.description: Education advisors are urging schools to help children avoid mental health problems for years to come due to the lockdown.

item.title: Some DHBs weeks away from restarting breast cancer screening
item.description: The Breast Cancer Foundation says potentially hundreds of women have no idea they have breast cancer because no screening was done under the level 4 lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19 sails off with NZ's America's Cup income
item.description: New Zealand is expected to miss out on about $150 million because half the superyachts due to follow next year's America's Cup have pulled out.

item.title: Warning over high nitrate levels in rural Hawke's Bay water
item.description: People in rural parts of central Hawke's Bay are being urged to test drinking water bores as nitrate levels in some areas soar.

item.title: Further unrest at nurses' union after series of setbacks
item.description: Former leaders of the New Zealand Nurses Organisation are backing a petition to remove its current board - the latest setback for the union.

item.title: No voluntary Covid-19 tests for Matamata cluster - Waikato DHB
item.description: The Waikato DHB says it can't offer voluntary Covid-19 tests for people who attended a St Patrick's Day party linked to one of the country's largest clusters.

item.title: Covid-19 screening expanded for rest home residents
item.description: Health officials have launched a new Covid-19 screening survey for rest home residents, expected to trigger more testing.

item.title: Was Covid-19 lockdown legal? A law expert explains
item.description: A former parliamentary counsel is putting the question of the legality of the lockdown to test, asking the High Court to rule lockdown level 4 and 3 illegal. Here's what it means and why the argument has come about.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown: No support person allowed as wife told of miscarriage
item.description: A woman was told she had suffered a miscarriage while her husband sat in the Auckland Hospital carpark 'alone and helpless", the Epidemic Response Committee heard today.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened on 6 May
item.description: After two days of no new cases being reported, today, a woman died from Covid-19 and more cases were confirmed. Here's today's developments.

item.title: Could the film industry revive Queenstown Lakes Covid-19 crippled economy?
item.description: The film and screen industry can help Queenstown Lakes' crippled economy emerge from the Covid-19 crisis, advocates say.

item.title: Redundancy payment will leave cleaner ‘worse off’
item.description: A cleaner made redundant because of Covid-19 says her redundancy payout means she can't get a benefit and it will leave her worse off in six months time.

item.title: Petition to ban all freedom camping when borders reopen
item.description: A petition to ban all foreign freedom campers in Aotearoa in order to support small businesses is circulating and gathering support.

item.title: Immigration NZ in 'disarray' over remote working as new law offers 'unbridled power'
item.description: With immigrants frustrated over delays to urgent visa queries, 1000 immigration staff were unable to work from home because of a lack of access to technology.
